Best Betting Apps UK

Online betting is hugely popular in the United Kingdom and there are dozens of UK betting apps available for punters to download.

Some are far better than others and it's our job to distinguish the best from the rest. But before we test and review betting apps, we need to ensure that it is safe, licensed and secure.

All of the betting apps featured on this page are licensed by the UK Gambling Commission. If a site isn't licensed and regulated by this Government body, it simply won't make our betting apps UK list.

When you sign up and claim a welcome bonus at any of the recommended betting apps, you can rest assured that you're dealing with a reputable UK bookmaker.

Why Trust Gambling.com to Find The Best Betting Apps UK?

When it comes to finding the best betting apps and betting sites, you can trust our judgement.

Why? Because, we've downloaded, installed, and used every betting app available and have evaluated every one for ease-of-use, speed and functionality.

We have a team of experienced industry experts and keen sports bettors on hand to rate and review all new betting apps as they are launched.

Below, you'll find overviews of the best mobile betting apps available to you today. We've examined each one closely to help you find the best app to bet with, whether you want to wager on sports , politics, TV specials, or whatever else tickles your fancy.

If you're into horse racing, you’ve probably heard of the Tote.

Betting on the Tote is a different way of operating. Essentially, when you place a bet on a race, all the money wagered on that specific race is pooled. That pool is then largely shared among the race winners.

The Tote has been around since 1928 at horse racecourses and in betting shops. It finally came online in 2019 and added a horse racing betting app in 2021.

The Tote site and bet app are mainly centred around horse racing, but football pool betting is available too. There is no fixed odds betting available at all, and betting on sports beyond horse racing, greyhounds and football is not available. There's no such thing as in-play betting via the Tote betting app either.

If you are into horse racing then you may get better dividends with the Tote as opposed to fixed odds betting, and the same goes for football pool betting too. It’s certainly something that you ought to give a go if you're a racing or football nut!

By signing up via Gambling.com, you can claim a Tote free bet on horse racing to get you started.

Pros
Placepot pool betting

Often better returns than fixed-odds
Cons
Horse racing, greyhounds and football only
No live betting options

How We Rank the UK’s Best Betting Apps        

So there you have it - 10 sites specially selected for the quality of their betting apps. In case you're wondering how we came up with our list, we thought we'd let you in on our judging criteria.

Below you'll find out how we examine the best betting apps UK, and the specific attributes we're looking for in each case.

  • Range of Mobile Betting Markets

    All betting apps should give access to the full range of betting markets. Most apps will of course cover football, horse racing, tennis, cricket, golf and US sports, but we like to see apps that go far beyond what is most popular. Coverage of Esports is now crucial too, given the rising popularity of competitive video gaming. If variety is what you're after, 888sport is a betting app that has you covered with its range of mobile betting markets.

  • Competitive Betting Odds

    The better the odds you are offered via a sports betting app, the better the profits you'll make if your bets win. We champion betting apps that offer competitive betting odds and especially those that excel against rival bookmakers. Price boosts are also a bonus. These are deals that allow you to boost your odds on a small number of the bets you make every day. Check out bet365 for frequent price boost deals.

  • In-Play Betting Features

    The best live betting sites and betting apps go hand-in-hand. When it comes to in-play betting, you have to react quickly. If you have to take the time to power up your PC or navigate to the specific match on the website, you may lose out. It's much easier to whip out your mobile or tablet and then place a bet with a stab of a finger. Luckster Sport has plenty of in-play betting features ,so its our app of choice for this style of betting.

  • Availability on Android & iOS

    Online bet apps should be available to everyone, regardless of which device you are using. Whether you are using a mobile phone or a tablet, you should expect a top-class experience either way. All the best betting apps that we highlight are compatible with iOS and Android devices, ensuring that almost every UK bettor can access them. They also have top-notch betting websites, in case you want to access your chosen betting app from a desktop computer at any stage.

  • Ease of Navigation

    You shouldn't need to ‘downgrade’ when you are using a betting app as opposed to a desktop site. Every function that’s available on the desktop should be available via the app too. You should never need to switch between the two – placing bets via the betting app but having to go to the desktop site to make a deposit or request a withdrawal, for example. We appreciate that tablets and phone have much smaller screens that laptops and desktop PCs, but we feel the any betting app should have honed the mobile experience to perfection, creating a superb app that’s a pleasure to use. BetVictor is a standout app in this regard.

  • Safety & Licensing

    As you will be divulging personal information with any sports betting app you download, the app must be perfectly secure with no possibility of any data leaks. For a start, any app we recommend will only ever come from a completely reputable bookmaker that has licensing from the United Kingdom Gambling Commission. iOS users can sign up their chosen betting site via the links on this page and can download the app via the Apple App Store. Android users have two options once they navigate to one of these recommended betting apps. Either download from Google Play or as an apk file directly from the site offering the sports betting app itself.

  • Customer Support

    If problems with online betting apps arise, it is nice to know a friendly and helpful customer support team is within easy reach. Therefore, our highlighted gambling apps offer multiple methods to contact support, such as live chat features, email, and phone support. We give extra points in our ranking system to apps that have support teams available 24/7, responding quickly to any customer queries or concerns. We test all customer service methods as part of our review process to ensure they are up to scratch and discount the ones that don't provide adequate support. Bet UK is a betting app that has one of the best customer support teams in the business.

  • Fast Payouts

    There is nothing worse than struggling to withdraw your money from online betting apps. However, all the apps listed on this page offer swift and straightforward payout processes, meaning you can get your hands on your hard-earned winnings without delay. They also cater to a range of payment methods, so that you can deposit and withdraw funds using the banking option of your choosing. The best betting apps in the UK all cater to Visa debit and MasterCard debit. E-wallets like Skrill and Trustly are often catered to as well, along with other methods like PayPal and Apple Pay. LeoVegas Sport is possibly the top bet app in the UK for variety of payment methods.

Why Download a Betting App?

You might be wondering if it's worth downloading a betting app when you could access a mobile betting site through Google Chrome or another web browser instead.

The simple answer is yes - because the best mobile betting apps have unique perks that mobile sites don't always provide. Let's take a look at some:

  • Speed: Speed is an important consideration when you're placing bets online, especially considering the rise of in-play betting. The best betting apps have lightning-quick loading times so you can navigate and place bets quickly.
  • Convenience: When you have a betting app saved on your phone's home screen, you can access the latest odds with just a couple of taps of your finger, rather than opening up a web browser and searching for a betting site every time you want to bet.
  • Notifications: Possibly the best reason for downloading a betting app is that you won't miss out on any promotions. Top betting apps send notifications to inform their customers of the latest deals and promos, like enhanced prices or money-back specials.
  • Adaptability: The best betting apps adapt seamlessly across multiple devices. You won't have to strain your eyes because the bet app will automatically adjust to the screen size - which isn't always the case with mobile betting sites.
  • Stream Quality: Live streaming is offered by the best betting apps, meaning you can watch sports like football, horse racing, tennis and cricket on a mobile device. The best betting apps have high-quality streams that load quickly.

The Best Betting App Features to Look For            

There are plenty of important features that should help you choose the best app to bet with.

We’ve summarised them in a handy table for you below, which displays the features that are available at the top UK betting apps. Read on to find out a bit more about each feature.

Bet Builder

A bet builder allows you the complete freedom to build your own same-game accumulator bets.

Bet builders allow you to combine several markets from the same event to increase your odds and profits should all parts of your bet builder to come in.

For example, say that Manchester City are playing Liverpool. You can add together Manchester City to win by two goals (4/1), Kevin De Bruyne to create at least one assist (7/1) and Virgil van Dijk to be booked (10/1). This combo bet has odds of 280/1, so even a tiny 50p stake could net you a very pleasing £140, if you get lucky.

Cash Out

Cash out comes hand-in-hand with live or in-play betting, but most cash out betting sites offer cash out on pre-event betting too.

Say in our match above, you’ve also placed a single bet on Manchester City to win. City were cruising at 3-0 so took Erling Haaland off but two Mo Salah strikes have put Liverpool right back in it, and currently the Anfield boys are battering the City rearguard.

You feel that Ederson’s net is about to be breached for the third time, so you cash out your bet that is currently winning. You will get a reduced payout compared to what you’d get if your bet lasted the distance, but that’s better than winning nothing at all.

Live Streaming

The best betting sites with live streaming also offer this service on their mobile betting apps. You'll be able to access those streams on your mobile devices as long as you can get a decent internet connection (4G at the minimum, WiFi is best).

Don’t expect to stream major competitions such as Premier League matches, Grand Slam tennis tournaments or major golf events. The broadcasting of such events is tied up with major media deals.

You will be able to stream many other events, though. For example, many of our recommended betting apps stream all of the horse racing and greyhound racing meets in the UK and Ireland.

Acca Insurance

Many sites offer acca insurance and you’ll be able to apply this promotion to your accumulator bets via mobile betting apps. With acca insurance, should any accumulator bet fail by just one selection, your stake is returned to you in the form of free bet funds.

It’s one way to reduce the pain of having an acca bet that oh-so-nearly paid off!

Free Bet Clubs

Free bet clubs seem to be replacing VIP schemes at online betting sites as a reward for frequent customers and any bets you place via a betting app will count towards your free bet club’s running total.

If you are a member of a free bet club, then you will need to meet each week’s criteria in order to earn your free bets.

Don’t think that you have to place hundreds of bets in order to qualify for your weekly free bet – sometimes placing a single bet of at least £5 is enough to meet the criteria!

The Best Football Betting Apps

The best football betting apps will give you access to all the top football matches taking place every day of the week all over the globe.

The best football betting sites have mobile bet apps that provide the easiest way to place your football bets, and extras such as bet builders and live streaming make the best football betting apps even more attractive.

If you enjoy betting on football, then having a football betting app in your back pocket is a complete no-brainer.
 

The Best Horse Racing Betting Apps

Thanks to the the internet, people who love to bet on horse racing have more choices than ever when it comes to placing their bets.

In the old betting shop days, coverage was limited to meetings in the UK and maybe Ireland. Now, thanks to horse racing betting sites and bet apps, racing punters can bet on meetings in France, the US, Australia, Japan, Saudi Arabia and many more countries.

Betting on horse racing is extremely easy when it comes to using the best sports betting apps. You only need a couple of stabs with your finger and doing this via a betting app is much easier than firing up your laptop or desktop computer.

Betting apps are making a bit of a comeback.

Between 2018 and 2021, sports betting sites in the UK seemed content to provide browser-based, mobile-optimised versions that people could navigate to and use on their mobile devices.

Since 2021 though, the trend seems to have moved back in favour of bespoke, downloadable bet apps.

In the mid-2010s, sports betting sites became enchanted by the idea of ‘mobile-optimised’ sites, which were sites that adapted themselves to whichever size screen they were currently being viewed on.

This meant that online sportsbooks could develop one single site as opposed to separate sites for desktop and mobile.

New betting sites now make sure they have top-notch betting apps ready to go when they launch, and happy punters are taking advantage of this.

You should always try out new betting apps to see what’s available, including innovative features and mobile-only promotions.

Top iOS Betting Apps

All online betting apps for iPhones and iPads can be found on the Apple App Store. All such betting apps are legal and legitimate – sports betting sites can offer their iOS bet apps on the App Store as long as they don't charge any money for the app or its installation.

If you find an online bookie that offers a bet app that’s not from the Apple App Store (although the installation of such apps is practically impossible) or charges money for it, then you need to avoid both the app and the bookmaker.

Top Android Betting Apps

Android mobile betting apps can be installed from Google Play or natively (i.e. in the form of an app file that you download and install on your device).

If your online bookie offers an Android betting app on Google Play then you'll need to physically be in the jurisdiction you're downloading it from. So, for UK betting apps, you'll need to download them from the UK version of Google Play.

apk files on the other hand can be installed anywhere. Make sure you only download and install legitimate bet apps in this way though. Unofficial apps can do all sorts of things to your devices so take care!

How to Download a Mobile Betting App

Downloading a mobile betting app to your phone or tablet is not complicated at all, but we're going to walk you through the process for iOS and Android users.

iOS/Apple Devices

  1. Use the links provided on this page to choose your preferred iOS betting app.
  2. Register for an account using your mobile/desktop browser and claim your welcome bonus.
  3. Head to the Apple App Store on the device you wish to install the bet app on.
  4. Once you're confident that you're installing the app you want, click the 'get' button. This should start the download. Remember, the betting app should be free to download – if you have to pay for it then it’s not a genuine app.
  5. The app will download and install all by itself – you do not need to do anything else.
  6. Once installed, open up the betting app and use the same login details as you use when accessing the desktop site. Once you are signed in, you're free to place your bets using your new sports betting app.

Android Devices

  1. Use the links provided on this page to choose your preferred Android betting app.
  2. Register for an account using your mobile/desktop browser and claim your welcome bonus.
  3. If the betting app is hosted on Google Play, use the link provided by the site or if there isn’t one, head to Google Play yourself and search for the app.
  4. If the bet app is provided directly as an apk file, click on the link provided and download the file to a convenient location. Once downloaded, head to the location and click on the apk file to install it. Your device may say ‘unable to install applications from unknown sources’ – if this happens head to your security settings and make the necessary changes, then click on the apk file again. This time it should install.
  5. If you downloaded the betting app from Google Play it will download and install automatically.
  6. Once installed, you can open up the app and use your login details to sign in. Now you can place your bets using your newly-installed Android sports betting app.

The Best Sports Betting App Sign Up Offers            

Welcome offers are available for all the best sports betting apps you'll find listed on this page. Specific, mobile-only betting bonuses are now rarely seen, sadly.

If you pick a bet app from a site that has a decent bonus, you can feel assured that such a site thinks highly of its customers and is generous with bonuses and promotions. A tight bonus with poor terms and conditions is a sign that a site (and app) should be given a wide berth.

Here are some of the most common types of bonuses offered by bet apps.

Stake & Get Offers

888 Betting Bonus

18+ • New customer offer • Min deposit £10 • A qualifying bet is a ‘real money’ stake of at least £10 • Min odds 1/2 (1.50) • Free Bets credited upon qualifying bet settlement and expire after 7 days • Free Bet stakes not included in returns • Casino Bonus must be claimed within 7 days and expires after 14 days • Bonus valid on selected Casino games only • Bonus wins capped at £500, excluding Jackpot wins • You must wager Bonus amount x40 – this requirement varies by game

These are usually worded along the lines of bet £10 get £30 or similar.

With such deals, you need to bet a minimum amount of your own money in order to get the bonus cash offered. In our example, if you place a minimum bet of £10 you will receive a £30 free bet once the bet has settled.

Such deals come with ‘minimum qualifying odds’ such as evens or 1/2 (1.50). This is to stop you placing your qualifying bet on a dead-cert with little risk of you losing your money. Free bet usage is likely to come with minimum odds too, and if your free bet is a winning one then your free bet stake is not returned, only your winnings.

Both your qualifying bet and bonus bet will have expiry dates, so make sure you make your qualifying bet and use your bonus bet before those time limits expire.

No-risk betting offers are practically identical to ‘bet X get X’ bonus offers, except that you only receive your bonus cash should your qualifying bet lose.

If it does lose, then you receive the equivalent amount (up to a limit) back as bonus free bet cash. If your qualifying bet wins, then you do not get your bonus money.

Bonus cash is subject to the same T&Cs as described in our ‘bet X get X’ explanation.

With these deals, any qualifying deposit you make will be matched by the betting app you are using.

For example, a ‘100% matched deposit up to £50’ offer will match the first £50 with another £50. A 50% match will give you half your deposit, a 200% match will double your deposit and so on.

There will be a minimum qualifying deposit, usually set at £10. If an offer has a minimum deposit amount of £10 and you only deposit £5, then obviously you will not get your bonus!

Deposit offers usually come with playthrough requirements rather than betting limits.

Boosted Odds Offers

Established 2007

Boosted odds deals give you enhanced prices on specific events. For example, say Liverpool are playing Newcastle in the Premier League and their regular odds for the win are 4/5. The offered boosted odds are 4/1. If you take this deal, then you'll get an inflated price on Liverpool to win the match.

There is one important caveat to this deal – all money you win in excess of the ‘normal’ odds is paid out as bonus cash. So, in our example above if you bet £10 on Liverpool and Liverpool won, you’d receive your £10 stake back, £8 ‘normal’ winnings and £32 ‘enhanced odds’ winnings as bonus cash.

Betting App v Web Browser             

There are plenty of benefits to betting with a betting app rather than using a web browser on your laptop or PC.

The main benefit is that your mobile device is likely to be at hand wherever you may happen to be.

A bet app is designed to make placing a bet as simple as possible. It’s easy to find your way around the menus and then find the event you wish to place a bet on. You can then place your bet with only a few stabs of a finger.

Managing your account is easy too, particularly when it comes to the transfer of funds. Many of us now pay at retailers using our phones, so we have Apple Pay and Google Wallet set up.

Many of the best sports betting apps will accept Apple Pay and Google Wallet payments and those that don’t usually accept PayPal, Skrill and/or Neteller, so you can have those payment methods set up with bet apps on your mobile device too.

There should also be no issues live streaming to a modern device if live streams are available with the sports betting app you are using.

The user experience all-round is simply better on a mobile betting app when compared to placing bets using a web browser on a desktop PC or laptop.

Below, we have listed some of the pros and cons of betting using a betting app, when compared to using a web browser:

Betting Apps Pros & Cons

Pros
Betting is more convenient with a betting app
Betting app interfaces designed to be user-friendly
Watch live-streamed events while out and about
Bet apps use less power than laptop or desktop PC
Cons
Smaller screen size means more navigation
Device may run out of charge or lose connection

In-Play Betting at The Best Betting Apps

The internet has made in-play betting possible, or at least much, much easier. In-play betting or live betting as it also known is where you bet on event that has already begun.

For example, in a football match, you can bet on the final score or winners of the game even though the game is well into the second half.

You could also bet on the next player to score a goal, the next team to win a throw-in, or even a specific substitution to be made. The same goes for any sports event that has commenced – tennis, golf, US sports and so on.

One aspect of sports betting apps that goes hand-in-hand with in-play betting is cash-out, although many betting apps will offer cash out on pre-event bets too. Cashing out a winning bet allows to you take the money before the bet has been settled, albeit for a reduced return.

Betting apps are absolutely ideal for both in-play betting and cash out, as they allow you to react quickly to the current state of play of any bet you have on or want to place.

Are Mobile Betting Apps Safe?                        

A mobile betting app is as safe as any other app that you might download to your device, as long as you obtain it from an official source.

Never download a bet app in the UK that’s not from a sports betting site with a valid United Kingdom Gambling Commission licence. You can be safe in the knowledge that all the apps listed on this page have are licensed by the UKGC.

Most betting apps now employ strict security features such as facial recognition technology or two-factor authentication to make themselves even more secure. The more security features an app has, the more secure it is, of course!

Payment Methods Available at Sports Betting Apps

You can use all the payment methods normally available at bookmakers at sports betting apps UK as well, along with mobile-only payment methods like Apple Pay. Below are some of the most common payment options available on the best sports betting apps:

Debit Cards

Most betting apps will accept Visa and MasterCard debit card deposits and withdrawals. You cannot use credit cards at any gambling site in the UK, as their use was banned by the UKGC in 2020.

E-wallets

E-wallets are an easy way of making and receiving payments using sports betting apps – secure too as you don’t have to divulge bank card details.

Commonly accepted e-wallet providers in the UK include PayPal, Skrill, Neteller, Trustly, MuchBetter, ecoPayz and Paysafecard.

Apple Pay & Android Pay

If you’ve set up Apple Pay or an Android-based payment system on your device (such as Google Wallet or Samsung Pay) then you may be able to pay at a bet app using that service.

Pay by Mobile Phone Bill

Customers with regular phone credit accounts in the UK with providers such as Vodafone, EE and Virgin may be able to make limited payments direct from their account credit. Commonly accepted services in this sphere include Boku, PayForIt and Zimpler. This is a deposit-only service and you are commonly limited to £30 per day.

Bank Transfer

If all else fails, you can simply transfer money from your bank using your banking app to the site at which you are placing wagers. Note that this payment method cannot be used for withdrawals.

Best Betting Apps UK - Summary

We hope this page has given you an insightful overview on the best betting apps available to sports bettors in the UK.

When choosing the best betting app, you need to know the app in question is safe, which is why we point you to secure, UKGC-licensed apps.

A bet app can offer ideal features such as in-play betting and cash-out, plus access to the best bonuses and deals that the top online betting sites offer.

We wish you all the best with the best UK betting apps and we hope you remember to always gamble responsibly.

FAQ

What is the best betting app UK?

The best betting app for you depends on your personal preferences, but you can't go wrong with the likes of Bet UK, LeoVegas Sport and 888sport. These are three of the most user-friendly, feature-packed betting apps available to UK bettors.

Why can't I download betting apps on Android?

The good news is that you can - although you may not always see betting apps on the Google Play Store. In these cases, you can go the mobile betting site on your internet browser and download the betting apps directly from the site.

What's the best betting app for football?

The betting apps listed on this page provide the best football betting app options. In particular, bet365 is one of the best football betting apps, with live streams of selected games and coverage of many different markets. Alternatively, try any of our other recommendations on this page to bet a variety of football competitions.

Which apps have free bets?

We've listed the best betting app free bet deals on this page for your convenience. You can access these bonus offers by clicking the 'visit site' button next to the betting app of your choice. Our betting experts regularly update this list with the best betting app free bets deals available in the UK.

What betting app has the best odds?

This all depends on the markets and sports you're betting on, as prices can vary greatly from one betting app to the next. From our testing, we've found that the BetVictor and mr.play Sport apps consistently have some of the best odds in the business.
